description: Next.js project initializes and development server starts successfully
steps: Step 1: Run pnpm install to install dependencies
Step 2: Run pnpm dev to start development server
Step 3: Verify server starts on localhost:3000 without errors
Step 4: Open browser and navigate to localhost:3000
Step 5: Verify homepage renders without console errors

description: TypeScript compilation passes without errors across all files
steps: Step 1: Run pnpm typecheck command
Step 2: Verify all TypeScript files compile without errors
Step 3: Verify no type warnings are present

description: ESLint passes with no warnings or errors
steps: Step 1: Run pnpm lint command
Step 2: Verify no ESLint errors are reported
Step 3: Verify no ESLint warnings are reported

description: Prisma database connection and migrations work correctly
steps: Step 1: Verify DATABASE_URL environment variable is set
Step 2: Run pnpm prisma migrate dev
Step 3: Verify migration completes successfully
Step 4: Run pnpm prisma db push to sync schema
Step 5: Open Prisma Studio with pnpm prisma studio
Step 6: Verify all tables are created correctly
Step 7: Verify schema matches spec (posts, projects, comments, subscribers, etc.)

description: Environment variables are properly configured and loaded
steps: Step 1: Copy .env.example to .env.local
Step 2: Fill in required environment variables
Step 3: Start development server
Step 4: Verify DATABASE_URL is accessible
Step 5: Verify NEXTAUTH_SECRET is set
Step 6: Verify no missing environment variable errors in console

Step 3: Locate a scheduled post on the calendar
Step 4: Drag the post to a different date
Step 5: Drop the post on new date
Step 6: Verify confirmation dialog appears
Step 7: Confirm reschedule
Step 8: Verify post moves to new date
Step 9: Navigate to Posts section
Step 10: Verify scheduled_for date is updated

description: Admin LinkedIn management lists all 25 promotional posts
steps: Step 1: Login to admin dashboard
Step 2: Navigate to LinkedIn section
Step 3: Verify LinkedIn posts listing loads
Step 4: Verify 25 LinkedIn posts are listed
Step 5: Verify each post shows linked blog post title
Step 6: Verify character count is displayed for each
Step 7: Verify status column shows pending/scheduled/posted
Step 8: Verify posts are linked to corresponding blog posts

description: Admin can preview LinkedIn post and copy to clipboard
steps: Step 1: Login to admin dashboard
Step 2: Navigate to LinkedIn section
Step 3: Click on a LinkedIn post to view details
Step 4: Verify post preview displays full content
Step 5: Verify character count is accurate
Step 6: Verify hashtags are displayed
Step 7: Verify associated image preview is shown
Step 8: Click 'Copy to Clipboard' button
Step 9: Verify success message
Step 10: Paste in another application to verify content copied

description: Admin can mark LinkedIn post as manually scheduled
steps: Step 1: Login to admin dashboard
Step 2: Navigate to LinkedIn section
Step 3: Select a pending LinkedIn post
Step 4: Check 'Already Scheduled in LinkedIn' checkbox
Step 5: Save changes
Step 6: Verify status changes to 'Manually Scheduled'
Step 7: Uncheck the checkbox
Step 8: Save changes
Step 9: Verify status reverts to 'Pending'

description: Admin analytics dashboard displays traffic overview
steps: Step 1: Login to admin dashboard
Step 2: Navigate to Analytics section
Step 3: Verify traffic overview section loads
Step 4: Verify page views chart is displayed
Step 5: Verify unique visitors metric is shown
Step 6: Verify time period selector works (7 days, 30 days, etc.)
Step 7: Select different time period
Step 8: Verify chart updates with new data
Step 9: Verify date range is accurate

description: Admin analytics displays top performing content
steps: Step 1: Login to admin dashboard
Step 2: Navigate to Analytics section
Step 3: Scroll to top content section
Step 4: Verify top pages are listed by views
Step 5: Verify blog posts are included in ranking
Step 6: Verify AI Agents series performance is visible
Step 7: Click on a page to see detailed analytics

description: Admin can moderate comments (approve, reject, spam)
steps: Step 1: Login to admin dashboard
Step 2: Navigate to Comments section
Step 3: Verify pending comments queue is displayed
Step 4: Select a pending comment
Step 5: Review comment content, author, email
Step 6: Click 'Approve' button
Step 7: Verify comment status changes to approved
Step 8: Navigate to the blog post
Step 9: Verify approved comment is now visible
Step 10: Return to admin, select another comment
Step 11: Click 'Mark as Spam' button
Step 12: Verify comment is removed/flagged as spam

description: Admin subscriber management displays list and allows export
steps: Step 1: Login to admin dashboard
Step 2: Navigate to Subscribers section
Step 3: Verify subscriber list is displayed
Step 4: Verify email addresses are shown
Step 5: Verify subscription date is shown
Step 6: Verify subscription source is shown (if tracked)
Step 7: Use search to find a specific subscriber
Step 8: Click 'Export CSV' button
Step 9: Verify CSV file downloads
Step 10: Open CSV and verify data format

description: Admin settings allows updating site metadata
steps: Step 1: Login to admin dashboard
Step 2: Navigate to Settings section
Step 3: Verify site metadata form is displayed
Step 4: Update site title
Step 5: Update site description
Step 6: Update social links
Step 7: Save settings
Step 8: Verify success message
Step 9: Navigate to public site
Step 10: Verify updated metadata is reflected (title, description)

description: Cron job auto-publishes scheduled posts
steps: Step 1: Create a test post scheduled for a specific past time
Step 2: Verify post status is 'Scheduled'
Step 3: Trigger cron endpoint /api/cron/publish-scheduled with CRON_SECRET
Step 4: Verify cron job executes successfully
Step 5: Verify post status changes to 'Published'
Step 6: Verify published_at is set correctly
Step 7: Navigate to public blog page
Step 8: Verify post is now visible

description: MDX Callout component renders correctly in blog posts
steps: Step 1: Navigate to a blog post containing Callout components
Step 2: Verify info callout renders with blue styling
Step 3: Verify warning callout renders with yellow styling
Step 4: Verify success callout renders with green styling
Step 5: Verify error callout renders with red styling
Step 6: Verify callout icons are displayed
Step 7: Verify callout content is readable

description: MDX CodeBlock component renders with syntax highlighting and copy
steps: Step 1: Navigate to a blog post containing code blocks
Step 2: Verify code block renders with proper formatting
Step 3: Verify syntax highlighting is applied (keywords, strings, etc.)
Step 4: Verify language label is displayed (e.g., 'javascript')
Step 5: Verify copy button is present
Step 6: Click copy button
Step 7: Verify code is copied to clipboard
Step 8: Verify success feedback on copy

description: MDX Quote component renders with attribution
steps: Step 1: Navigate to a blog post containing Quote components
Step 2: Verify quote text renders with distinctive styling
Step 3: Verify quote attribution (source) is displayed
Step 4: Verify quote marks or visual indicators are present
Step 5: Verify responsive behavior on mobile

description: MDX Accordion component expands and collapses sections
steps: Step 1: Navigate to a blog post with Accordion components
Step 2: Verify accordion sections are collapsed by default
Step 3: Click on accordion header to expand
Step 4: Verify content animates open
Step 5: Click again to collapse
Step 6: Verify content animates closed
Step 7: Test multiple accordion items independently

description: MDX Chart component renders data visualizations
steps: Step 1: Navigate to a blog post with Chart components
Step 2: Verify chart renders (bar, line, or pie)
Step 3: Verify data is displayed correctly
Step 4: Verify chart labels are readable
Step 5: Hover over chart elements
Step 6: Verify tooltip appears with data details
Step 7: Verify chart is responsive on different screens

description: All pages have correct meta tags for SEO
steps: Step 1: Navigate to homepage
Step 2: Verify title tag contains site name
Step 3: Verify meta description is present and meaningful
Step 4: Navigate to /about page
Step 5: Verify unique title and description
Step 6: Navigate to /projects page
Step 7: Verify unique title and description
Step 8: Navigate to /blog page
Step 9: Verify unique title and description
Step 10: Navigate to a blog post
Step 11: Verify post-specific title and description
Step 12: Navigate to /research page
Step 13: Verify research-specific title and description

description: Open Graph meta tags are properly set for social sharing
steps: Step 1: Navigate to homepage
Step 2: View page source or DevTools
Step 3: Verify og:title is present
Step 4: Verify og:description is present
Step 5: Verify og:image is present (1200x630)
Step 6: Verify og:url is present and correct
Step 7: Verify og:type is set (website, article)
Step 8: Navigate to a blog post
Step 9: Verify post-specific og:image
Step 10: Verify og:type is 'article'
Step 11: Test URL in Facebook debugger tool

description: Twitter Card meta tags are properly configured
steps: Step 1: Navigate to a blog post
Step 2: View page source
Step 3: Verify twitter:card is set to 'summary_large_image'
Step 4: Verify twitter:title is present
Step 5: Verify twitter:description is present
Step 6: Verify twitter:image is present
Step 7: Test URL in Twitter Card validator

description: Sitemap is generated correctly and excludes scheduled posts
steps: Step 1: Navigate to /sitemap.xml
Step 2: Verify sitemap XML is valid
Step 3: Verify homepage URL is included
Step 4: Verify /about, /projects, /blog, /research URLs are included
Step 5: Verify published blog post URLs are included
Step 6: Verify scheduled (unpublished) post URLs are NOT included
Step 7: Verify lastmod dates are accurate

description: JSON-LD structured data is present and valid
steps: Step 1: Navigate to homepage
Step 2: View page source
Step 3: Locate JSON-LD script tags
Step 4: Verify Person schema is present with author info
Step 5: Navigate to a blog post
Step 6: Verify Article schema is present
Step 7: Verify author, datePublished, headline are set
Step 8: Navigate to /research page
Step 9: Verify ResearchProject schema if applicable
Step 10: Validate schemas using Google's Rich Results Test

description: RSS feed is generated and valid
steps: Step 1: Navigate to /rss.xml or /feed.xml
Step 2: Verify RSS feed XML is returned
Step 3: Verify feed title and description
Step 4: Verify blog posts are included as items
Step 5: Verify item titles, links, descriptions are correct
Step 6: Verify pubDate is set for each item
Step 7: Validate RSS feed using W3C validator

description: Keyboard navigation works across all interactive elements
steps: Step 1: Navigate to homepage
Step 2: Press Tab to move through interactive elements
Step 3: Verify focus indicator is visible on each element
Step 4: Verify navigation links are accessible via Tab
Step 5: Verify CTA buttons are accessible
Step 6: Press Enter on focused link
Step 7: Verify navigation occurs
Step 8: Navigate to contact form
Step 9: Tab through all form fields
Step 10: Verify form is fully keyboard accessible
Step 11: Test escape key closes modals/menus

description: Screen reader announces content correctly with ARIA labels
steps: Step 1: Enable screen reader (VoiceOver, NVDA)
Step 2: Navigate to homepage
Step 3: Verify page title is announced
Step 4: Verify navigation landmark is announced
Step 5: Verify main content landmark is announced
Step 6: Navigate to interactive elements
Step 7: Verify button labels are announced correctly
Step 8: Verify image alt text is announced
Step 9: Navigate through a blog post
Step 10: Verify headings hierarchy is correct
Step 11: Verify links announce their destinations

description: Reduced motion preference disables animations
steps: Step 1: Enable 'Reduce Motion' in system preferences
Step 2: Navigate to homepage
Step 3: Verify hero animations are disabled or reduced
Step 4: Scroll through the page
Step 5: Verify scroll-triggered animations are disabled
Step 6: Verify page transitions are instant or minimal
Step 7: Navigate to timeline section
Step 8: Verify timeline animations respect preference

description: Homepage is fully responsive at desktop viewport (1440px)
steps: Step 1: Set viewport to 1440px width
Step 2: Navigate to homepage
Step 3: Verify hero section fills appropriate width
Step 4: Verify navigation is horizontal layout
Step 5: Verify content sections have proper max-width
Step 6: Verify project cards display in multi-column grid
Step 7: Verify footer spans full width appropriately
Step 8: Take screenshot for visual verification

description: Homepage is fully responsive at tablet viewport (768px)
steps: Step 1: Set viewport to 768px width
Step 2: Navigate to homepage
Step 3: Verify navigation adapts appropriately
Step 4: Verify hero section resizes properly
Step 5: Verify content sections stack or reflow
Step 6: Verify project cards adjust to 2-column or 1-column
Step 7: Verify text remains readable (not too small)
Step 8: Verify touch targets are appropriately sized
Step 9: Take screenshot for visual verification

description: Homepage is fully responsive at mobile viewport (375px)
steps: Step 1: Set viewport to 375px width
Step 2: Navigate to homepage
Step 3: Verify hamburger menu is displayed
Step 4: Verify hero text is readable and sized correctly
Step 5: Verify all content stacks vertically
Step 6: Verify project cards are single column
Step 7: Verify no horizontal scrolling is needed
Step 8: Verify touch targets are at least 44x44px
Step 9: Verify footer content stacks appropriately
Step 10: Take screenshot for visual verification

description: Blog post page is responsive and readable on mobile
steps: Step 1: Set viewport to 375px width
Step 2: Navigate to a blog post
Step 3: Verify article title is readable
Step 4: Verify body text size is comfortable (16px+)
Step 5: Verify images scale to fit viewport
Step 6: Verify code blocks scroll horizontally if needed
Step 7: Verify TOC is accessible (collapsible menu)
Step 8: Verify series navigation is usable
Step 9: Verify comments section is responsive

description: Homepage achieves Lighthouse performance score >= 90
steps: Step 1: Build production version (pnpm build)
Step 2: Start production server (pnpm start)
Step 3: Open Chrome DevTools
Step 4: Run Lighthouse audit on homepage
Step 5: Verify Performance score is >= 90
Step 6: Verify no major performance issues flagged
Step 7: Document specific metrics (LCP, FID, CLS)

description: Blog post page achieves Lighthouse performance score >= 90
steps: Step 1: Build production version
Step 2: Start production server
Step 3: Navigate to a content-heavy blog post
Step 4: Run Lighthouse audit
Step 5: Verify Performance score is >= 90
Step 6: Verify images are optimized (Next.js Image)
Step 7: Verify code blocks don't block rendering

description: Core Web Vitals meet thresholds (LCP < 2.5s, FID < 100ms, CLS < 0.1)
steps: Step 1: Build and deploy to production/staging
Step 2: Use PageSpeed Insights to test homepage
Step 3: Verify LCP (Largest Contentful Paint) < 2.5s
Step 4: Verify FID (First Input Delay) < 100ms
Step 5: Verify CLS (Cumulative Layout Shift) < 0.1
Step 6: Test blog listing page
Step 7: Verify Core Web Vitals pass
Step 8: Test blog post page
Step 9: Verify Core Web Vitals pass

description: Images are properly optimized with Next.js Image component
steps: Step 1: Navigate to homepage
Step 2: Open Network tab in DevTools
Step 3: Verify images are served in modern format (WebP/AVIF)
Step 4: Verify images are appropriately sized (not oversized)
Step 5: Verify images have lazy loading (below fold)
Step 6: Verify hero image loads with priority
Step 7: Navigate to a blog post with images
Step 8: Verify in-content images are optimized

description: API endpoint GET /api/posts returns paginated post list
steps: Step 1: Make GET request to /api/posts
Step 2: Verify 200 status response
Step 3: Verify response contains posts array
Step 4: Verify pagination metadata (total, page, limit)
Step 5: Request page 2 with ?page=2
Step 6: Verify different posts returned
Step 7: Filter by category ?category=theme
Step 8: Verify only theme posts returned
Step 9: Filter by tag ?tag=ai-agents
Step 10: Verify only tagged posts returned

description: API endpoint POST /api/contact creates contact submission
steps: Step 1: Make POST request to /api/contact with valid data
Step 2: Include name, email, subject, message in body
Step 3: Verify 200/201 status response
Step 4: Verify success message in response
Step 5: Check database for new contact_submission entry
Step 6: Make POST with missing required fields
Step 7: Verify 400 status with validation errors
Step 8: Make POST with invalid email
Step 9: Verify email validation error

description: API endpoint POST /api/subscribe adds new subscriber
steps: Step 1: Make POST request to /api/subscribe with valid email
Step 2: Verify 200/201 status response
Step 3: Verify success message
Step 4: Check database for new subscriber entry
Step 5: Make POST with same email again
Step 6: Verify appropriate response (already subscribed)
Step 7: Make POST with invalid email
Step 8: Verify validation error

description: Admin API endpoints require authentication
steps: Step 1: Make GET request to /api/admin/posts without auth
Step 2: Verify 401 Unauthorized response
Step 3: Make POST request to /api/admin/posts without auth
Step 4: Verify 401 Unauthorized response
Step 5: Login and obtain session token
Step 6: Make GET request with valid session
Step 7: Verify 200 response with data
Step 8: Verify admin-only data is returned

Step 11: Verify Conference category has 3 posts
Step 12: Verify Methodology category has 1 post

Step 6: Verify Week 5 (Jan 5-9) has 3 posts scheduled

Step 9: Verify Week 8 (Jan 26-30) has 2 posts scheduled

Step 11: Verify Week 10 (Feb 9-13) has 2 posts scheduled

description: Email notifications send on contact form submission

Step 4: Verify email contains form submission details
Step 5: Verify email sender is from EMAIL_FROM address
Step 6: Verify email formatting is correct

description: Newsletter welcome email sends on subscription
steps: Step 1: Configure email service in development
Step 2: Subscribe with a test email address

Step 4: Verify email contains welcome message
Step 5: Verify unsubscribe link is present
Step 6: Verify email formatting and branding

description: Error 404 page displays correctly for non-existent routes

Step 2: Verify 404 page is displayed
Step 3: Verify page title indicates 'Page Not Found'
Step 4: Verify helpful message is shown
Step 5: Verify navigation back to home is available
Step 6: Verify search bar or suggestions are present

steps: Step 1: Trigger a server error (e.g., bad API call)
Step 2: Verify 500 error page is displayed
Step 3: Verify page title indicates 'Something Went Wrong'
Step 4: Verify retry button is available
Step 5: Verify navigation to home is available
Step 6: Verify contact support option is present

description: Vercel deployment succeeds without errors
steps: Step 1: Push code to main branch
Step 2: Monitor Vercel deployment logs
Step 3: Verify build completes without errors
Step 4: Verify deployment preview URL is accessible
Step 5: Navigate through all public pages on preview
Step 6: Verify no console errors in production build
Step 7: Promote to production
Step 8: Verify production URL is accessible

Step 4: Verify schedule is '0 * * * *' (hourly)

Step 7: Verify scheduled posts are published as expected

description: Privacy policy page is accessible and contains required content

Step 2: Verify page loads correctly

Step 4: Click and hold button

Step 4: Tab to email input

description: Admin session expires correctly and redirects to login

Step 2: Verify dashboard loads

Step 5: Verify redirect to login page

Step 2: Navigate to timeline management section

Step 7: Edit the event
